Fields.DialogueText: Capitaine, I believe I've come up with a solution to our conundrum.
Reverse props, Algérie. What conundrum?
The problem of having a tea ceremony for the crew.
I didn't realize it was a problem.
Only logistically. I believe if we...
Hold on a moment, Algérie. That's what I originally wanted to speak with you about.
Oui? And?

Fields.MenuText: You're going to handle everything.
I think it would be best if you took control of this one, Algérie.
I can't dedicate the time. This will have to be up to you.

Fields.DialogueText: I... well, that's a surprise, Capitaine.
You... you don't want to assist in this?
I... oui, Capitaine, if you feel it is best.
I have faith in you, Algérie. Take this in the best possible light – I need this off my plate to...
Morganas sighted! Action stations!
Let's go.
Oui, Capitaine. We'll pick this up later.
@BATTLE
Capitaine, I have just a few questions regarding the tea ceremony for the crew.
I told you, Algérie, I'm counting on you to oversee it.
Capitaine, just a moment...
Not... Algérie, this is not the best time for this. I'm sorry.
Have I done something, Capitaine?

Fields.MenuText: Not in the least. Please, pay it no mind.
Only the guilty worry, Algérie.
I wouldn't say that, Algérie, but I don't have the time to explain further.

Fields.DialogueText: I... it will be as you say, mon capitaine.
I am guiltless, mon capitaine.
You couldn't even spare a few seconds, mon capitaine?
Algérie, you promised not to call me that anymore.
My apologies, Captain. Sometimes I slip when I am under stress.
Algérie, I told you not to worry about this. I just have responsibilities I must attend to on my own.
Can I help? I would be happy to assist you, if you're in need.
*ALARM*
The ceremony can wait. I just hate to see you under stress if I could do anything.
I'll let you know if that becomes necessary.
@BATTLE
Back to the discussion, Capitaine...
What... not this again. Algérie, as I said, I have responsibilities. They are mine to attend to - no one else's.
I'm sorry, Captain, but I just can't help but worry that you're overburdening yourself.
You have no reason to be concerned. Put it all out of your head.
As long as I'm unaware of what's burdening you, I'm not sure I'll be able to do so. Won't you allow me to help you fight this battle?

Fields.MenuText: There are some things you can't fight, Algérie.
You don't load ammunition before a storm, Algérie.
You can't fight what you're not engaging, Algérie.

Fields.DialogueText: I can fight anything I put my mind to, Captain.
You do if you want to win, Captain.
If you're in the fight, Captain, then so am I.
You argue quite persuasively, do you know that?
I've made the most of the many opportunities you've given me.
And so humble too.
Spit it out, Captain. No more stalling.
Very well. I...
Looks like now isn't a good time.
Don't think I'll forget about this.
Oh, I won't.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
So you don't think I've forgotten, this is for you.
A letter? How thoughtful.
It's not from me.
Oh?
It's to me.
Then why...
It's about you.
O-oh!

Fields.MenuText: Remember, never shoot the messenger.
Bad things happen to those who attack their captain. Just remember that.
Just keep in mind I didn't write it - it was delivered to me.

Fields.DialogueText: You're frightening me, Captain.
You're frightening me, Captain.
You're frightening me, Captain.
Thank you. You're dismissed.
@BATTLE
All I ask is that you read it in private, perhaps in your tent?
Very well, it shall be as you ask.
All I ask is that you read it in private, perhaps in your tent?
I shall endeavor not to attack you, then.
All I ask is that you read it in private, perhaps in your tent?
Then I shall save my ire for the one who penned it.
*ALARM*
I hope she opens it before this battle, at least...
Capitaine!
Now, now, what did we say about this? I told you, I didn't write the letter.
Tell me who did so that I may defend myself!
I can't do that.
Can't, or won't?
Both... but I would lean more toward the former.
Explain yourself.

Fields.MenuText: Excuse me?
You forget yourself, Algérie!
I'm sorry, I must have misheard you.

Fields.DialogueText: Mes excuses, mon capitaine.
Mes excuses, mon capitaine.
Mes excuses, mon capitaine.
Perhaps when you're calmer?
Good, let the Morganas feel my wrath. Let us make way to the bridge!
@BATTLE
Algérie...
Non! I apologize for nothing. Tell me who this is!
Algérie...
Non! I forget nothing, including insults. Tell me who wrote this!
Algérie...
Non! You heard me perfectly. Tell me who wrote this!
*ALARM*
Feeling better now?
Non, still furious... but I suppose I am calm enough to not tear this person apart.
Well, that's a step in the right direction. Ready to talk now?
Ready to discuss the identity of the author of this... this... trash?
Will you keep your temper in check?
Well enough.

Fields.MenuText: I guess that's good enough, then.
As I said before, I have faith in you.
I'd feel better if you were a bit less ambivalent... but okay.

Fields.DialogueText: I guess it is.
Despite what this trash says?
And I'd feel better if this person were on the bottom of the...
Algérie, manners!
Why start now?
Let it out. This isn't like you.
Well then, now you know a little more of my emotional range.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Need to shoot something?
There are some problems tea cannot solve.
And that's how the letter came about.
So let me recap. You were talking to another captain about our... thoughts on feelings... and this is the response?
That's about the long and short of it.
And is this someone you trust?
Implicitly.
And how do you know this person?
Back channels. They...
They who?
Unspecified. I neither confirm nor deny the gender of the author.
What happened to that faith you had in me, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: It's shaken not an inch.
Still solid as a rock.
I'm starting to rethink it.

Fields.DialogueText: Bien. I suppose there is that.
I must say I'm surprised.
You are not being funny.
Why do you say that?
Just by the way you've been acting ever since you got the letter. At least, that's when I assume you started having these thoughts, oui?
Oui.
Excuse me, please. I need some time to think.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Bad time to be a Morgana, then.
How goes your thinking time?
Not done yet.
Any idea when you will be done?
Have patience, oui?

Fields.MenuText: Take all the time you need.
Just let me know when you're ready to talk.
I won't wait forever, but you have some time.

Fields.DialogueText: Merci.
You'll be the first to know, Capitaine.
Well then, I've not a moment to waste.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Do you think you might want to talk it over in the tent after the battle?
I will have to see, Capitaine. There are steps to processing such affronts. I have not quite reached the sharing stage.
I'll be there when you do. You'd do the same for me.
In a heartbeat.
Algérie, a moment?
Still thinking, Captain.
No, it's not about that. I need to know how the tea ceremony planning is going.
The tea... Captain, are you serious?

Fields.MenuText: Is the Pope Catholic?
Did the Titanic take on a little water?
Does a bear... you know?

Fields.DialogueText: I have no idea what you're talking about.
I have no idea what you're talking about.
I have no idea what you're talking about.
Say what you want. I think it was worth it. Now, seriously, about that ceremony?
I haven't done much since this letter, truth be told.
Well, the idea was sound back when you were focused, so it's just as sound now. Don't let this one slip off the deck or you'll regret it.
Message received, Captain. I'll get back on the planning. Excuse me.
@BATTLE
Yes, but at least it got that expression off your face.
What expression?
The one that made you look like you swallowed a dead cat tail first.
That's disgusting!
Yes, but at least it got that expression off your face.
What expression?
The one that made you look like you swallowed a dead cat tail first.
I can't believe you!
Yes, but at least it got that expression off your face.
What expression?
The one that made you look like you swallowed a dead cat tail first.
Why do I even listen to you?
*ALARM*
I said excuse me...
I think I have the logistics worked out for the ceremony, Captain, if you'd like to look over them.
Do you want me to look them over?
No, not really. I know they'll work, I was just being polite.
I appreciate the courtesy. Can I speak with you about the letter now?
Can... all right, we've ignored it long enough. What's it about?
I was having a conversation with another INPF captain.
Who? Was it...
As I said, I'm not telling you. May I continue?
Do I have a choice?

Fields.MenuText: Only so long as your answer is yes.
Not so much, no.
I wish it were that simple.

Fields.DialogueText: Then speak on, mon capitaine.
As I suspected. Please continue.
Were it so for everything. Continue... please.
As I was saying, in the midst of a conversation with another captain, the question of propriety came up.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Quick. What did they mean "propriety?"
Captain-Belle fraternization. Authority problems. Ethics. No time to explain.
Acknowledged. Thank you for summing up.
Care to continue your story, Captain?
About the conversation regarding my feelings towards you? Only because I care, yes.
I'm not sure how to take that. Not after reading this letter.
You do remember that this was a letter written to me, not by me, correct? I swear we've been over this.
Yes, but the way it addresses certain concerns, I have to assume that these are in response to specific questions. You cannot lay this entirely at the other captain's feet.
Perhaps not. Continue your line of thought.
Perhaps? What do you mean perhaps?

Fields.MenuText: It means that perhaps you're right and perhaps you're not.
It means that you should keep going.
It means I'm not agreeing to your presuppositions.

Fields.DialogueText: You can be quite infuriating, do you know that?
I shall, and you shall listen, oui?
You looked that up, didn't you?
I will simply answer you with a smile. Go on.
No, I believe you were telling me about the discussion?
Ah yes, so I was. I was speaking with this captain about my feelings towards you and how I feared they could interfere with our mission out here when...
Wait, your feelings towards me?
Haven't we been over this part before?
Yes, but never so openly.
You see, this is why I was talking with another captain. Sometimes all it takes is another perspective to assuage concerns.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
I agree with you, Capitaine... and right at this moment I am annoyed that I do.
Care to tell me about these feelings of yours, Capitaine?
I am not a simple creature, Algérie. Coming out into the open with these thoughts isn't something I do with ease.
But how can you keep them inside? How can they not crush you?
Which is why I had to talk them out with someone.
Someone who wasn't me?
Someone who could give me a more objective opinion of things, yes.
And this person was in opposition?

Fields.MenuText: You're jumping to conclusions.
Any reason you think they would be?
And you think they should have leapt to your defense?

Fields.DialogueText: I'd say I've been led to the conclusion lake and am simply taking a drink.
Of course they would be. I'm a mystical, mythical creature from the great beyond, and people fear what they do not understand!
How could they when you had so obviously poisoned the well of disbelief?
You are without a doubt the most interesting person I have ever met.
I... excuse me?
How you can go from one concern to the next without so much as a transition... fascinating.
I'm not sure how to take that.
As a compliment. Besides, we...
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
I find I'm able to set things aside for later consideration. As now.
We need to finish this conversation, Capitaine.
Which part, the one where you're automatically angry at me, or the part where you want to tear my confidant apart?
Tear apart might be a slight exaggeration.
But only a slight one.
You're lucky I'm not one of those nasty Zara-class cruisers.
No, no, please don't go.
But your after action reports... you always write them after a battle.
Those can wait. For now, we need to talk about the letter.
That's sweet, but I have a few things to attend to as well. Shall we recommence at a later time?

Fields.MenuText: Ah... okay then.
I'm so confused.
Have it your way.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Capitaine.
Welcome to my world. I hope you enjoy the view.
I shall, Capitaine. I shall.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Though they certainly know their way around a fight.
I'm not dragging this out to torment you.
No, no you are not. I'm no Fadhma n'Soumer waiting for the French to kill her.
Rushing into anything would be just as improper, though. This conversation deserves as much attention as we can spare.
Agreed. We shall table it while I return to planning. That always clears my mind.
Is this a good time?
No more stalling? No more interruptions?
I can't control the sea, but as to my part, no.
All right. The other captain I spoke with gave me their advice and reasons why someone in my position shouldn't engage in a relationship with someone like... well... you.
You see? I'm holding myself back already.
Yes, very well. The other captain has done their best to persuade me. I've considered their arguments seriously.
And?
And they have merit.
I see. So you...

Fields.MenuText: Not yet, Algérie. Be patient.
Stop... jumping... to conclusions! Please!
Algérie, just... be patient.

Fields.DialogueText: The suspense is killing me!
The suspense is killing me!
The suspense is killing me!
... I deserved that.
I really should not find Morganas as useful for stress relief as I do. I'm not Pola.
@BATTLE
I didn't think you could die from something like that.
You'd be surprised!
I didn't think you could die from something like that.
Now who's jumping to conclusions?
I didn't think you could die from something like that.
I guess you'll have to wait and see.
*ALARM*
Thank goodness for that. She's a handful.
What do you expect? Zaras are tigresses.
Let's just get back to my letter.
I'm holding my tongue.
Miracles do occur.
I... no, holding tongue.
Hah, test passed. Anyway, in the letter, my fellow captain suggested I take several steps back and look at the complications of a relationship.
What kind of complications, pray tell?
Most importantly, the fact that you're technically serving under me.
C-Capitaine!

Fields.MenuText: Not... ah... oh my.
Leave it to you to think that way.
I can't believe you're going to make me do this, but...

Fields.DialogueText: Serves you right!
How else should I think?
CAPITAINE!
Thank God. We'll pick this up at a later time... and with a cleaner mind.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
From both of us.
As I was saying, since you are technically serving under my authority, I am considered your superior officer.
I was unaware that I was serving under your authority, Capitaine.
Really? Do you follow my orders?
Well, yes.
Then you're serving under my authority.
I don't think I like that definition.

Fields.MenuText: Me neither, really, but there it is.
I like it just fine.
It's what we have, so it'll have to do.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, then. We should think about changing it.
Hrmmph. Very well, Capitaine, do continue.
Oui, I understand.
Be that as it may, it is clear that...
Will these ever cease?
Not until the war is over, and that won't happen if we don't do our jobs. Come on, let's go.
Is that an order, Captain?
Don't be a pain, Algérie. Let's get moving.
Grr... All these interruptions. It seems I have gotten to know you a little better than I would like.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
So what you're saying is that we can't have a relationship because you can order me around?
I didn't say that.
But that's what you mean.
Once you boil it down, yes, that's what it means... although the word "can't" isn't quite correct.
Then what word is?
Shouldn't.
Sounds like splitting hairs to me.

Fields.MenuText: And sometimes a hair's breadth can make all the difference.
Which can sometimes be the difference between a hit and a miss.
Where's your sense of faith, Algérie?

Fields.DialogueText: Between a tickle and a choke? Oui, I guess so.
Oui, and that can make the difference between being sunk and slinking away.
Placed in a higher power as always, Captain.
The difference between "can't" and "shouldn't" is one of ethics. What you can do versus what you should.
Yes, I understand the words, Captain.
But not the meaning behind them. Algérie, what I'm trying to tell you is...
You wish it weren't so complicated.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Essentially, yes.
That does make me feel better, Capitaine. I also wish this.
Algérie, about the finer points of "can't" versus "shouldn't", I'd like to explain what...
No need to explain, Captain.
Really? What changed?
Just the fact that I don't care what a random person says about our relationship. I'd rather let a camel invade my tent than let someone, known or not, have a say in my life like that.
Algérie...
No, Captain, this is my decision, not someone's who is half an ocean away! What befuddles me is that it's your decision too, and yet you let yourself...
Algérie.
... yourself get all tangled in knots over nothing more than...
Algérie!
Oui? What is it?
Sorry to interrupt your excellent tirade, but I have something that needs saying.
Spit it out.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not letting someone else make my decisions for me.
I am the captain of my own fate, so to speak.
You've got a lot of nerve, making me say it like this.

Fields.DialogueText: Then tell me your decision!
And on what course is your heart set?
Not any more than you do having made me wait!
I only asked this person's advice, Algérie. I just wanted to hear the devil's advocate, so to speak.
And what was...
Merde, merde, merde...
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Let me get this out of the way before anything else happens to us.
Merci!
I simply asked for the other captain's opinion so I could hear the arguments both for and against the idea. I never said I would follow their recommendations.
And what was your decision, then?

Fields.MenuText: That I would do as I will it and no other.
That my future is my choice, no one else's.
That despite the good points raised by the other captain, I choose my own path.

Fields.DialogueText: That sounds like it bodes well.
Does that mean what I think it means?
And do you choose a path that has me on it?
It could, but there are things to address first.
Things that can be addressed, or things that can't be ignored?
I'm... not sure what you're asking.
I'm asking if any of these things are slits in our tents.
Um... that's not really any clearer.
Merde!
Capitaine!
Come on, let's get to it.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Can we start over?
What do you mean?
I mean that we've gotten ourselves out of phase on the whole issue.
That's because...
No, no, let's not go down that path anymore. We have to get over this hump. There's a reason we're stuck, but we can't let that hold us back anymore.
What's the reason?
So we're going to stay mired in the mud instead of moving forward, then?
Non... and oui.
So you want to know why we're stuck before we can move on?
It would help me understand, yes.
Fine. We're stuck because of...

Fields.MenuText: Fear... it's because of fear.
Misunderstandings... just because of misunderstandings.
You, frankly. We're stuck because of you.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not afraid, not anymore at least.
Ah, if only we could travel back in time and start fresh.
Well... I... I don't know what to say.
It doesn't matter anymore, right? We're moving forward?
Oui. Forward.
@BATTLE
Oh, don't tell me...
Morganas?
To the winds with caution. A kiss speaks louder and quicker.
Now I am ready.
So what does moving forward look like?
Tea. It looks like tea.
Capitaine?
It means you offer me tea in your tent and we talk.
Very well. If you'll follow me, I can...
No, not like this. You have to have things prepared.
What's going on with you?

Fields.MenuText: I'm setting the stage.
That's looking back, not forward.
You're just now noticing who I am?

Fields.DialogueText: By having me do the work?
Are you sure it isn't sideways?
And how strange you can be... but the solution, as always, is the same.
Forward, Algérie, forward.
As you command, Capitaine, oui.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
None of that command nonsense. Is this what you want?
At last we speak the same language.
What's this?
Your invitation.
Where did you find the time to paint a mug?
Recall which of us needs sleep and which of us doesn't.
Fair enough. Er, Algérie...
Yes?
There's no date or time.
Oui.
What's that mean?
It's an open invitation. Come whenever you're ready. I'll have things prepared no matter what.

Fields.MenuText: So you're saying I can just stop by?
No time limit? No requirements?
How can you keep things ready at a moment's notice?

Fields.DialogueText: As clearly as I can, Capitaine.
Non, non.
Remember the no sleep talk earlier? Same way.
All right, I'll take that under consideration. Thank you for the invite... and the mug.
Avec plaisir.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
This is going to be a long after action report...
I hesitate to ask this, Capitaine, but...
No hesitation necessary, Algérie. Speak your mind.
Very well then. Why haven't you come to visit?
I'm not ready yet.
What's holding you back?

Fields.MenuText: Don't spoil the surprise, Algérie.
None of your business, really.
Not holding back so much as biding my time.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, when you put it that way, all right.
Huh! Very well!
Intriguing. Very well, I shall keep my counsel and bide my time.
When you least expect it, Algérie. When you least expect it.
@BATTLE
Capitaine, you know I respect your process and methods of dealing with your personal feelings.
But?
...But nothing. I would be lying if it did not make me anxious. But it would not be fair to you if I vented those feelings here.
Morganas, on the other hand...
Love must be fair. War, less so.
Ah, Capitaine, I see you've come to take me up on my offer for tea.
I've decided to visit your tent, yes. I brought my own mug.
Of course you did. Please, have a seat.
Thank you, but I fear I can't stay for long.
You... you're rejecting my offer for tea?
No, I just know how things go around here. It's been too long between Morgana sightings. I'm sure we'll no sooner sit down for tea than...
Prescient!
@BATTLE
So about tea?
I can't. The after action reports don't write themselves.
Will we ever have a quiet moment?

Fields.MenuText: Only once this war is won.
Us, quiet? Since when has that been on the menu?
Only in our dreams, Algérie.

Fields.DialogueText: Then I suggest we put our minds to it and finish.
Since we desire it! After all, there's nothing we can't do together, non?
And I don't even sleep. How sad.
*ALARM*
And that's why we...
@BATTLE
I assume you need to do your after action reports again?

Fields.MenuText: Nope, not today. I told the officer of the watch to fill them out. I'll pencil whip them later.

Fields.DialogueText: Capitaine, are you feeling well? This isn't like you at all.
No, it isn't, is it? That's because it's time for tea, and by God I'm going to have a mug come hell or high water!
Are you saying what I think you're saying?
*ALARM*

Fields.MenuText: I do. But not right away.

Fields.DialogueText: Shirking your duties, Capitaine? Is that the example you want to set?

Fields.MenuText: For once, I'm a step ahead of you.

Fields.DialogueText: That isn't the answer I was looking for. It's not even really an answer.
It tastes better from the one you made me.
That's because I made it with -
-Love? You're sentimental, Algérie, but even that's a little -
-Care and precision, Capitaine! Have you any idea how hard it is to keep a kiln running at sea?
As hard as it is to make a silk tent bigger on the inside? How do you do that, anyway?
Don't question nice things. I certainly don't.
I'm a thing, am I?
My thing?
As you command.
